module.description: The DSP system module controls several features of the DSP, e.g. clock control, DMA event synchronization, PLL settings, and the CLKOUT source.

bitfield.description: McBSP CLKS selection bit.Determines which pin of the McBSP is fed to S05 when the Serial Port 0 Mode is set to 11.

bitenum.description: McBSP CLKR signal is routed to Serial Port 0 pin S05.
McBSP CLKS signal is routed to Serial Port 0 pin S05

bitfield.description: Parallel port mode bits. These bits control the pin muxing on the parallel port.
Serial port 1 mode bits. These bits control the pin muxing on serial port 1.
Serial port 0 mode bits. These bits control the pin muxing on serial port 0.
This bit controls the pin multiplexing on EM_A[20].
This bit controls the pin multiplexing on EM_A[19].
This bit controls the pin multiplexing on EM_A[18].
This bit controls the pin multiplexing on EM_A[17].
This bit controls the pin multiplexing on EM_A[16].
This bit controls the pin multiplexing on EM_A[15].

System clock disable bit. This bit can be used to turn off the system clock. Setting the WAKEUP pin high enables the system clock. Since the WAKEUP pin is used to re-enable the system clock, the WAKEUP pin must be low to disable the system clock.
I2S2 clock gate control bit. This bit is used to enable and disable the I2S2 peripheral clock.
Timer 2 clock gate control bit. This bit is used to enable and disable the Timer 2 peripheral clock.
Timer 1 clock gate control bit. This bit is used to enable and disable the Timer 1 peripheral clock.

EMIF clock gate control bit. This bit is used to enable and disable the EMIF peripheral clock. NOTE: You must request permission before stopping the EMIF clock through the peripheral clock stop request/acknowledge register (CLKSTOP).
Timer 0 clock gate control bit. This bit is used to enable and disable the Timer 0 peripheral clock.
MCSPI clock gate control bit. This bit is used to enable and disable the MCSPI peripheral clock.
I2S0 clock gate control bit. This bit is used to enable and disable the I2S0 peripheral clock.
MMC/SD1 clock gate control bit. This bit is used to enable and disable the MMC/SD1 peripheral clock.
I2C clock gate control bit. This bit is used to enable and disable the I2C peripheral clock.
McBSP clock gate control bit. This bit is used to enable the disable the McBSP peripheral clock
MMC/SD0 clock gate control bit. This bit is used to enable and disable the MMC/SD0 peripheral clock.
DMA controller 0 clock gate control bit. This bit is used to enable and disable the peripheral clock the DMA controller 0.

UART clock gate control bit. This bit is used to enable and disable the UART peripheral clock. NOTE: You must request permission before stopping the UART clock through the peripheral clock stop request/acknowledge register (CLKSTOP).
SPI clock gate control bit. This bit is used to enable and disable the SPI controller peripheral clock.
I2S3 clock gate control bit. This bit is used to enable and disable the I2S3 peripheral clock.
McSPI SPIREF Clock Gate Control bit. This bit is used to enable and disable the clock to the McSPI SPIREF block.

Analog registers clock gate control bit. This bit is used to enable and disable the clock to the registers that control the analog domain of the device, i.e. registers in the 7000h-70FFh I/O space address range. NOTE: When SARCG = 0, the clocks to the analog domain registers is enabled regardless of the ANAREGCG setting.
DMA controller 3 clock gate control bit. This bit is used to enable and disable the peripheral clock the DMA controller 3.
DMA controller 2 clock gate control bit. This bit is used to enable and disable the peripheral clock the DMA controller 2.
DMA controller 1 clock gate control bit. This bit is used to enable and disable the peripheral clock the DMA controller 1.

USB clock gate control bit. This bit is used to enable and disable the peripheral clock the USB. NOTE: You must request permission before stopping the USB clock through the peripheral clock stop request/acknowledge register (CLKSTOP).

SAR clock gate control bit. This bit is used to enable and disable the SAR peripheral clock. NOTE: When SARCG = 0, the clocks to the analog domain registers is enabled regardless of the ANAREGCG setting.
HPI clock gate control bit. This bit is used to enable and disable the HPI peripheral clock.

Count bits. These bits specify the number of system clock (SYSCLK) cycles the software reset bits are asserted. When the software counter reaches 0, the software reset bits will be cleared to 0. Always initialize this field with 20h.
Peripheral group 4 self-cleraing software reset disable bit. Drives the HPI, I2S2, I2S3, UART, and SPI reset signal.
MCBSP self-cleraing software reset disable bit. Drives the MCBSP self-cleraing software reset disable signal.
Peripheral group 3 self-cleraing software reset disable bit. Drives the MMC/SD0, MMC/SD1, I2S0, and MCSPI self-cleraing software reset disable signal.
DMA self-cleraing software reset disable bit. Drives the self-cleraing software reset disable signal to the DMA controllers.
USB self-cleraing software reset disable bit. Drives the USB self-cleraing software reset disable signal.
Analog registers and SAR self-cleraing software reset disable bit. Drives the analog register and SAR self-cleraing software reset disable signal.
Drives the EMIF self-cleraing software reset disable signal.
I2C self-cleraing software reset disable bit. Drives the I2C self-cleraing software reset disable signal.
Peripheral group 4 software reset bit. Drives the HPI, I2S2, I2S3, UART, and SPI reset signal.

bitenum.description: Reset deasserted, modules out of reset.

bitfield.description: MCBSP software reset bit. Drives the MCBSP reset signal.

bitenum.description: Reset deasserted, modules out of reset.

bitfield.description: Peripheral group 3 software reset bit. Drives the MMC/SD0, MMC/SD1, I2S0, and MCSPI reset signal.

bitenum.description: Reset deasserted, modules out of reset.

bitfield.description: DMA software reset bit. Drives the reset signal to the DMA controllers.

bitenum.description: Reset deasserted, modules out of reset.

bitfield.description: USB software reset bit. Drives the USB reset signal.

bitenum.description: Reset deasserted, module out of reset.

bitfield.description: Analog registers and SAR reset bit. Drives the analog register and SAR reset signal.

bitenum.description: Reset deasserted, module out of reset.

bitfield.description: Drives the EMIF and Timer reset signal.

bitenum.description: Reset deasserted, modules out of reset.

bitfield.description: I2C software reset bit. Drives the I2C reset signal.

bitenum.description: Reset deasserted, module out of reset.

bitfield.description: Timer 2 interrupt flag bit. This bit latches the timer interrupt signal when the timer counter expires. You can clear this flag bit by writing a 1 to it.

bitenum.description: Timer has not generated an interrupt.

bitfield.description: Timer 1 interrupt flag bit. This bit latches the timer interrupt signal when the timer counter expires. You can clear this flag bit by writing a 1 to it.

bitenum.description: Timer has not generated an interrupt.

bitfield.description: Timer 0 interrupt flag bit. This bit latches the timer interrupt signal when the timer counter expires. You can clear this flag bit by writing a 1 to it.

bitenum.description: Timer has not generated an interrupt.

bitfield.description: McSPI Wake-Up Interrupt Flag. Connected to McSPI SWAKEUP. Write a 1 to this register to clear the interrupt flag.
McSPI Interrupt Flag. Connected to McSPI SInterrupt. Write a 1 to this register to clear the interrupt flag.
CLKOUT pin output drive strength bits. These bits set the drive strength for the CLKOUT pin.
EMIF pin output drive strength bits. These bits set the drive strength for the EMIF pins.
Serial port pin 15 pull-down inhibit bit. Setting this bit to 1 disables the pin internal pull-down.
Serial port pin 14 pull-down inhibit bit. Setting this bit to 1 disables the pin internal pull-down.
Serial port pin 13 pull-down inhibit bit. Setting this bit to 1 disables the pin internal pull-down.
Serial port pin 12 pull-down inhibit bit. Setting this bit to 1 disables the pin internal pull-down.
Serial port pin 11 pull-down inhibit bit. Setting this bit to 1 disables the pin internal pull-down.
Serial port pin 10 pull-down inhibit bit. Setting this bit to 1 disables the pin internal pull-down.
Serial port pin 5 pull-down inhibit bit. Setting this bit to 1 disables the pin internal pull-down.
Serial port pin 4 pull-down inhibit bit. Setting this bit to 1 disables the pin internal pull-down.
Serial port pin 3 pull-down inhibit bit. Setting this bit to 1 disables the pin internal pull-down.
Serial port pin 2 pull-down inhibit bit. Setting this bit to 1 disables the pin internal pull-down.
Serial port pin 1 pull-down inhibit bit. Setting this bit to 1 disables the pin internal pull-down.
Serial port pin 0 pull-down inhibit bit. Setting this bit to 1 disables the pin internal pull-down.
CLKIN pin pull-down inhibit bit. Setting this bit to 1 disables the pin internal pull-down.
Interrupt 1 pin pull-up inhibit bit. Setting this bit to 1 disables the pin internal pull-up.
Interrupt 0 pin pull-up inhibit bit. Setting this bit to 1 disables the pin internal pull-up.
Reset pin pull-up inhibit bit. Setting this bit to 1 disables the pin internal pull-up.
EMU1 and EMU0 pin pull-up inhibit bit. Setting this bit to 1 disables the pin internal pull-up.
TDI pin pull-up inhibit bit. Setting this bit to 1 disables the pin internal pull-up.
TMS pin pull-up inhibit bit. Setting this bit to 1 disables the pin internal pull-up.
TCK pin pull-up inhibit bit. Setting this bit to 1 disables the pin internal pull-up.
TRST pin pull-down inhibit bit. Setting this bit to 1 disables the pin internal pull-down.
TDO pin pull-up inhibit bit. Setting this bit to 1 disables the pin internal pull-up.
EMIF A[20] pin pull-down inhibit bit. Setting this bit to 1 disables the pin internal pull-down.
EMIF A[19] pin pull-down inhibit bit. Setting this bit to 1 disables the pin internal pull-down.
EMIF A[18] pin pull-down inhibit bit. Setting this bit to 1 disables the pin internal pull-down.

EMIF A[16] pin pull-down inhibit bit. Setting this bit to 1 disables the pin internal pull-down.
EMIF A[15] pin pull-down inhibit bit. Setting this bit to 1 disables the pin internal pull-down.
Parallel port 15 pin pull-down inhibit bit. Setting this bit to 1 disables the pin internal pull-down.
Parallel port 14 pin pull-down inhibit bit. Setting this bit to 1 disables the pin internal pull-down.
Parallel port 13 pin pull-down inhibit bit. Setting this bit to 1 disables the pin internal pull-down.
Parallel port 12 pin pull-down inhibit bit. Setting this bit to 1 disables the pin internal pull-down.
Parallel port 11 pin pull-down inhibit bit. Setting this bit to 1 disables the pin internal pull-down.
Parallel port 10 pin pull-down inhibit bit. Setting this bit to 1 disables the pin internal pull-down.
Parallel port 9 pin pull-down inhibit bit. Setting this bit to 1 disables the pin internal pull-down.
Parallel port 8 pin pull-down inhibit bit. Setting this bit to 1 disables the pin internal pull-down.
Parallel port 7 pin pull-down inhibit bit. Setting this bit to 1 disables the pin internal pull-down.
Parallel port 6 pin pull-down inhibit bit. Setting this bit to 1 disables the pin internal pull-down.
Parallel port 5 pin pull-down inhibit bit. Setting this bit to 1 disables the pin internal pull-down.
Parallel port 4 pin pull-down inhibit bit. Setting this bit to 1 disables the pin internal pull-down.
Parallel port 3 pin pull-down inhibit bit. Setting this bit to 1 disables the pin internal pull-down.
Parallel port 2 pin pull-down inhibit bit. Setting this bit to 1 disables the pin internal pull-down.
Parallel port 1 pin pull-down inhibit bit. Setting this bit to 1 disables the pin internal pull-down.
Parallel port 0 pin pull-down inhibit bit. Setting this bit to 1 disables the pin internal pull-down.

register.description: Defines the synchronization events for DMA0 channel 1 and 0.

bitfield.description: Channel 1 synchronization events. When SYNCMODE = 1 in the channel DMATCR2, the CH1EVT bits in the DMAnCESR registers specify the synchronization event for activity in the DMA controller.
Channel 0 synchronization events. When SYNCMODE = 1 in the channel DMATCR2, the CH0EVT bits in the DMAnCESR registers specify the synchronization event for activity in the DMA controller.

register.description: Defines the synchronization events for DMA0 channel 3 and 2.

bitfield.description: Channel 3 synchronization events. When SYNCMODE = 1 in the channel DMATCR2, the CH3EVT bits in the DMAnCESR registers specify the synchronization event for activity in the DMA controller.
Channel 2 synchronization events. When SYNCMODE = 1 in the channel DMATCR2, the CH2EVT bits in the DMAnCESR registers specify the synchronization event for activity in the DMA controller.

register.description: Defines the synchronization events for DMA1 channel 1 and 0.

bitfield.description: Channel 1 synchronization events. When SYNCMODE = 1 in the channel DMATCR2, the CH1EVT bits in the DMAnCESR registers specify the synchronization event for activity in the DMA controller.
Channel 0 synchronization events. When SYNCMODE = 1 in the channel DMATCR2, the CH0EVT bits in the DMAnCESR registers specify the synchronization event for activity in the DMA controller.

register.description: Defines the synchronization events for DMA1 channel 3 and 2.

bitfield.description: Channel 3 synchronization events. When SYNCMODE = 1 in the channel DMATCR2, the CH3EVT bits in the DMAnCESR registers specify the synchronization event for activity in the DMA controller.
Channel 2 synchronization events. When SYNCMODE = 1 in the channel DMATCR2, the CH2EVT bits in the DMAnCESR registers specify the synchronization event for activity in the DMA controller.
External Oscillator Resistance Enable.

bitenum.token: Internal 1Mohm resistor between X1 and X0

bitenum.description: No internal resistor between X1 and X0, external resistor required

bitfield.description: System clock source bits. These read-only bits reflect the source for the system clock.

bitenum.description: The system clock generator is in bypass mode; SYSCLK is driven by the RTC oscillator output.
The system clock generator is in lock mode; the RTC oscillator output provides the input clock.
The system clock generator is in bypass mode; SYSCLK is driven by CLKIN.
The system clock generator is in lock mode; the CLKIN pin provides the input clock.

bitfield.description: Timer0 clock source select bit. This bit specifies the input clock to Timer0.

bitenum.description: Timer0 uses SYSCLK as input clock.
Timer0 uses PLL output clock (PLLOUT) as input clock.

bitfield.description: CLK_SEL pin status bit. This reflects the state of the CLK_SEL pin.

bitenum.description: CLK_SEL pin is low (RTC input clock selected).
CLK_SEL pin is high (CLKIN input clock selected.)

bitfield.description: System clock source select bit. This bit is used to select between the two main clocking modes for the DSP: bypass and lock mode. In bypass mode, the DSP clock generator is byassed and the system clock is set to either CLKIN or the RTC output (as determined by the CLKSEL pin). In lock mode, the system clock is set to the output of the DSP clock generator. Logic in the system clock generator prevents switching from bypass mode to lock mode if the PLL is powered down. After settings SYSCLKSEL = 1, you can check the SYSCLKSRC bits to determine if the system clock generator is in lock mode.
PLL Multiplier [15:0]
PLL Multiplier [16]

Reference input frequency divider. The frequency inputted to the Phase Detector must fall between 1.7MHz and 6.79MHz. These are connected to CLKR[5:0] in PLL027SSP. Divides the input clock rate to the PLL by the following number: 000000 = Divide-by-1 000001 = Divide-by-2. & 111111 = Divide-by-64
Bypass PLL. This is connected to BYPASS in PLL027SSP. 0 = PLL is enabled. 1 = PLL is bypassed and VCO is powered down.
Resets the PLL and clears the PLL Multiplier and Reference dividers. This is equivalent to activating RESET in PLL027SSP. 0 = PLL is normal operating mode. 1 = PLL is reset

bitenum.description: PLL is in normal operating mode

bitfield.description: PLL power down. 0 = PLL is powered. 1 = PLL is powered down.
Output Divider 2 value. This is connected to second output divider following PLL027SSP. 00000 = Divide-by-2 00001 = Divide-by-4 00010 = Divide-by-6 00011 = Divide-by-8 ... 11111 = Divide-by-64
Output Divider 2 Bypass. Bypasses the second output divider 0 = Output Divider 2 is enabled 1 = Output Divider 2 is bypassed
Output Divider value. This is connected to CLKOD[2:0] in PLL027SSP. 000 = Divide-by-1 001 = Divide-by-2. & 111 = Divide-by-8
Output Enable for the CLKOUT pin s output buffer: 0 = Output driver is enabled 1 = Output driver is tristated

CLKOUT Divider value: 000 = CLKOUT represents the System clock divided by 1 001 = CLKOUT represents the System clock divided by 2 010 = CLKOUT represents the System clock divided by 4 011 = CLKOUT represents the System clock divided by 6 100 = CLKOUT represents the System clock divided by 8 101 = CLKOUT represents the System clock divided by 10 110 = CLKOUT represents the System clock divided by 12 111 = CLKOUT represents the System clock divided by 14
CLKOUT source bits. These bits specify the source clock for the CLKOUT pin.

bitenum.description: CLKOUT pin outputs System PLL output clock, PLLOUT.
CLKOUT pin outputs System PLL output clock, PLLOUT.
CLKOUT pin outputs System PLL output clock, PLLOUT.
CLKOUT pin outputs System PLL output clock, PLLOUT.
CLKOUT pin outputs USB PLL output clock.
CLKOUT pin outputs System PLL output clock, PLLOUT.
CLKOUT pin outputs System PLL output clock, PLLOUT.
CLKOUT pin outputs system clock, SYSCLK (default mode).
CLKOUT pin outputs System PLL output clock, PLLOUT.
CLKOUT pin outputs System PLL output clock, PLLOUT.
CLKOUT pin outputs USB PLL output clock.

bitfield.description: EMIF clock divider select bits. The EMIF module can internally divide its input peripheral clock. When this bit is set to 0, the EMIF operates at half the clock rate of its peripheral clock. When this bit is set to 1 the EMIF operates at the full rate of its peripheral clock.

bitenum.description: EMIF operates at half the peripheral clock rate.
EMIF operates at the same rate as the peripheral clock.

bitfield.description: RTC Isolation Control. The reset state of this register is low which isolates the CVDD_RTC power domain from the VDDC power domain. This protects the RTC from corruption when VDDC powers up. The DSP must write a 1 to this register before accessing the RTC registers. DSP software should try to minimize the amount of time while this bit is set high so that the RTC is better protected from VDDC powerdown events. 0 = RTC is isolated. DSP reads/writes to the RTC registers will be blocked. 1 = RTC is not isolated. DSP is able to read/write the RTC registers.
DARAM7 SLPZVDD Memory Standby Enable for DARAM7 0 = Enable DARAM7 SLPVDD during memory standby. 1 = Do not enable DARAM7 SLPVDD during memory standby (normal functional mode).
DARAM7 SLPZVSS Memory Standby Enable for DARAM7 0 = Enable DARAM7 SLPVSS during memory standby. 1 = Do not enable DARAM7 SLPVSS during memory standby (normal functional mode).

SARAM19 SLPZVSS Memory Standby Enable for SARAM19 0 = Enable SARAM19 SLPVSS during memory standby. 1 = Do not enable SARAM19 SLPVSS during memory standby (normal functional mode).

register.description: Use this register to see which DMA channels have generated interrupts.

bitfield.description: DMA controller 3, channel 3 interrupt status bit.
DMA controller 3, channel 2 interrupt status bit.
DMA controller 3, channel 1 interrupt status bit.
DMA controller 3, channel 0 interrupt status bit.
DMA controller 2, channel 3 interrupt status bit.
DMA controller 2, channel 2 interrupt status bit.
DMA controller 2, channel 1 interrupt status bit.
DMA controller 2, channel 0 interrupt status bit.
DMA controller 1, channel 3 interrupt status bit.
DMA controller 1, channel 2 interrupt status bit.
DMA controller 1, channel 1 interrupt status bit.
DMA controller 1, channel 0 interrupt status bit.
DMA controller 0, channel 3 interrupt status bit.
DMA controller 0, channel 2 interrupt status bit.
DMA controller 0, channel 1 interrupt status bit.
DMA controller 0, channel 0 interrupt status bit.

register.description: Use this register to enabled DMA controller channel interrupts.

bitfield.description: DMA controller 3, channel 3 interrupt enable bit.
DMA controller 3, channel 2 interrupt enable bit.
DMA controller 3, channel 1 interrupt enable bit.
DMA controller 3, channel 0 interrupt enable bit.
DMA controller 2, channel 3 interrupt enable bit.
DMA controller 2, channel 2 interrupt enable bit.
DMA controller 2, channel 1 interrupt enable bit.
DMA controller 2, channel 0 interrupt enable bit.
DMA controller 1, channel 3 interrupt enable bit.
DMA controller 1, channel 2 interrupt enable bit.
DMA controller 1, channel 1 interrupt enable bit.
DMA controller 1, channel 0 interrupt enable bit.
DMA controller 0, channel 3 interrupt enable bit.
DMA controller 0, channel 2 interrupt enable bit.
DMA controller 0, channel 1 interrupt enable bit.
DMA controller 0, channel 0 interrupt enable bit.
USB module power.
USB VBUS session end comparator enable.

bitenum.description: USB VBUS session end comparator is disabled.
USB VBUS session end comparator is enabled.

bitfield.description: USB VBUS detect enable.

bitenum.description: USB VBUS detect comparator is disabled.
USB VBUS detect comparator is enabled.

bitfield.description: USB PLL enable.

bitenum.description: Override USB suspend end behavior and force release of PLL from suspend state.

bitfield.description: Reserved. Always write 0 to these bits.
USB data polarity bit.

bitenum.description: Reverse polarity on DP and DM signals.

bitfield.description: USB internal oscillator bias resistor disable.

bitenum.description: Internal oscillator bias resistor enabled (normal operating mode).

bitfield.description: USB oscillator disable bit.Reset value will be level on CLK_SEL
USB byte mode select bits.

bitenum.description: Word accesses by the CPU are allowed.
Byte accesses by the CPU are allowed (high byte is selected).
Byte accesses by the CPU are allowed (low byte is selected).

bitfield.description: EMIF byte mode select bits. These bits control CPU data and program accesses to external memory as well as CPU accesses the EMIF memory-mapped registers.

bitenum.description: Word accesses by the CPU are allowed.
Byte accesses by the CPU are allowed (high byte is selected).
Byte accesses by the CPU are allowed (low byte is selected).

bitfield.description: Read-only bits that reflect the latched state of the A[20:15] pins on the clock edge after RESETN pin went high. The value is used by the bootloader to determine boot mode. 0 = corresponding I/O pin was latched as LOW. 1 = corresponding I/O pin was latched as HIGH. Reset value will be A[20:15]

register.description: Defines the synchronization events for DMA2 channel 1 and 0.

bitfield.description: Channel 1 synchronization events. When SYNCMODE = 1 in the channel DMATCR2, the CH1EVT bits in the DMAnCESR registers specify the synchronization event for activity in the DMA controller.
Channel 0 synchronization events. When SYNCMODE = 1 in the channel DMATCR2, the CH0EVT bits in the DMAnCESR registers specify the synchronization event for activity in the DMA controller.

register.description: Defines the synchronization events for DMA2 channel 3 and 2.

bitfield.description: Channel 3 synchronization events. When SYNCMODE = 1 in the channel DMATCR2, the CH3EVT bits in the DMAnCESR registers specify the synchronization event for activity in the DMA controller.
Channel 2 synchronization events. When SYNCMODE = 1 in the channel DMATCR2, the CH2EVT bits in the DMAnCESR registers specify the synchronization event for activity in the DMA controller.

register.description: Defines the synchronization events for DMA3 channel 1 and 0.

bitfield.description: Channel 1 synchronization events. When SYNCMODE = 1 in the channel DMATCR2, the CH1EVT bits in the DMAnCESR registers specify the synchronization event for activity in the DMA controller.
Channel 0 synchronization events. When SYNCMODE = 1 in the channel DMATCR2, the CH0EVT bits in the DMAnCESR registers specify the synchronization event for activity in the DMA controller.

register.description: Defines the synchronization events for DMA3 channel 3 and 2.

bitfield.description: Channel 3 synchronization events. When SYNCMODE = 1 in the channel DMATCR2, the CH3EVT bits in the DMAnCESR registers specify the synchronization event for activity in the DMA controller.
Channel 2 synchronization events. When SYNCMODE = 1 in the channel DMATCR2, the CH2EVT bits in the DMAnCESR registers specify the synchronization event for activity in the DMA controller.
UHPI clock stop acknowledge bit. This bit is set to 1 when the UHPI has acknowledged a request for its clock to be stopped. The UHPI clock should not be stopped until this bit is set to 1.

bitenum.description: The request to stop the peripheral clock has not been acknowledged.
The request to stop the peripheral clock has been acknowledged, the clock can be stopped.

bitfield.description: UHPI peripheral clock stop request bit. When disabling the UHPI internal peripheral clock, you must set this bit to 1 to request permission to stop the clock. After the UHPI acknowledges the request (UHPICLKSTPACK = 1) you can stop the clock through the peripheral clock gating control register 1 (PCGCR2). When enabling the MCSPI internal clock, enable the clock through PCGCR1, then set UHPICLKSTPREQ to 0.

bitenum.description: Request permission to stop the peripheral clock.

bitfield.description: McBSP clock stop acknowledge bit. This bit is set to 1 when the McBSP has acknowledged a request for its clock to be stopped. The McBSP clock should not be stopped until this bit is set to 1.

bitenum.description: The request to stop the peripheral clock has not been acknowledged.
The request to stop the peripheral clock has been acknowledged, the clock can be stopped.

bitfield.description: McBSP peripheral clock stop request bit. When disabling the McBSP internal peripheral clock, you must set this bit to 1 to request permission to stop the clock. After the McBSP acknowledges the request (MBPCLKSTPACK = 1) you can stop the clock through the peripheral clock gating control register 1 (PCGCR1). When enabling the McBSP internal clock, enable the clock through PCGCR1, then set MBPCKLSTPREQ to 0.

bitenum.description: Request permission to stop the peripheral clock.

bitfield.description: UART clock stop acknowledge bit. This bit is set to 1 when the UART has acknowledged a request for its clock to be stopped. The UART clock should not be stopped until this bit is set to 1.

bitenum.description: The request to stop the peripheral clock has not been acknowledged.
The request to stop the peripheral clock has been acknowledged, the clock can be stopped.

bitfield.description: UART peripheral clock stop request bit. When disabling the UART internal peripheral clock, you must set this bit to 1 to request permission to stop the clock. After the UART acknowledges the request (URTCLKSTPACK = 1) you can stop the clock through the peripheral clock gating control register 1 (PCGCR1). When enabling the UART internal clock, enable the clock through PCGCR1, then set URTCKLSTPREQ to 0.

bitenum.description: Request permission to stop the peripheral clock.

bitfield.description: USB clock stop acknowledge bit. This bit is set to 1 when the USB has acknowledged a request for its clock to be stopped. The USB clock should not be stopped until this bit is set to 1.

bitenum.description: The request to stop the peripheral clock has not been acknowledged.
The request to stop the peripheral clock has been acknowledged, the clock can be stopped.

bitfield.description: USB peripheral clock stop request bit. When disabling the USB internal peripheral clock, you must set this bit to 1 to request permission to stop the clock. After the USB acknowledges the request (USBCLKSTPACK = 1) you can stop the clock through the peripheral clock gating control register 2 (PCGCR2). When enabling the USB internal clock, enable the clock through PCGCR2, then set USBCKLSTPREQ to 0.

bitenum.description: Request permission to stop the peripheral clock.

bitfield.description: EMIF clock stop acknowledge bit. This bit is set to 1 when the EMIF has acknowledged a request for its clock to be stopped. The EMIF clock should not be stopped until this bit is set to 1.

bitenum.description: The request to stop the peripheral clock has not been acknowledged.
The request to stop the peripheral clock has been acknowledged, the clock can be stopped.

bitfield.description: EMIF peripheral clock stop request bit. When disabling the EMIF internal peripheral clock, you must set this bit to 1 to request permission to stop the clock. After the EMIF acknowledges the request (EMFCLKSTPACK = 1) you can stop the clock through the peripheral clock gating control register 1 (PCGCR1). When enabling the EMIF internal clock, enable the clock through PCGCR1, then set EMFCKLSTPREQ to 0.

bitenum.description: Request permission to stop the peripheral clock.

bitfield.description: MCSPI bridge clock stop acknowledge bit. This bit is set to 1 when the MCSPI bridge has acknowledged a request for its clock to be stopped. The MCSPI bridge clock should not be stopped until this bit is set to 1.

bitenum.description: The request to stop the peripheral clock has not been acknowledged.
The request to stop the peripheral clock has been acknowledged, the clock can be stopped.

bitfield.description: MCSPI bridge peripheral clock stop request bit.

bitenum.description: Request permission to stop the peripheral clock.

bitfield.description: MCSPI clock stop acknowledge bit. This bit is set to 1 when the MCSPI has acknowledged a request for its clock to be stopped. The MCSPI clock should not be stopped until this bit is set to 1.

bitenum.description: The request to stop the peripheral clock has not been acknowledged.
The request to stop the peripheral clock has been acknowledged, the clock can be stopped.

bitfield.description: MCSPI peripheral clock stop request bit. When disabling the MCSPI internal peripheral clock, you must set this bit to 1 to request permission to stop the clock. After the MCSPI acknowledges the request (MSPCLKSTPACK = 1) you can stop the clock through the peripheral clock gating control register 1 (PCGCR1). When enabling the MCSPI internal clock, enable the clock through PCGCR1, then set MSPCKLSTPREQ to 0.

bitenum.description: Request permission to stop the peripheral clock.

register.description: Divides the system clock to obtain the functional and OCP clocks

bitfield.description: Takes the System VBUS Clock and divides it down for the McSPI OCP clock (CLK). 0000 = Divide-by-1 0001 = Divide-by-2 0010 = Divide-by-4 0011 = Reserved

Takes the System Clock and divides it down for the McSPI functional clock (SPIREFCLK). 0000 = Divide-by-1 0001 = Divide-by-2 0010 = Divide-by-4 0011 = Divide-by-6 0100 = Divide-by-8 0101 = Divide-by-10 0110 = Divide-by-12 0111 = Divide-by-14 1000 = Divide-by-16 1001 = Divide-by-18 1010 = Divide-by-20 1011 = Divide-by-22 1100 = Divide-by-24 1101 = Divide-by-26 1110 = Divide-by-28 1111 = Divide-by-30
McSPI Wake-Up Interrupt Enable

bitenum.description: McSPI Wake-Up will not interrupt the CPU.
McSPI Wake-Up will be Or ed with other McSPI0 interrupts to the CPU

bitfield.description: McSPI SInterrupt Enable.

bitenum.description: McSPI0 SInterrupt will not interrupt the CPU
McSPI0 Sinterrupt will be Or ed with other McSPI0 interrupts to the CPU.

bitfield.description: Timer2 Interrupt Selection 0 = Timer2 interrupt is routed to CPU TINT 1 = Timer2 interrupt is routed to CPU NMI

bitenum.description: Timer2 interrupt is routed to CPU TINT
Timer2 interrupt is routed to NMI

bitfield.description: Timer1 Interrupt Selection 0 = Timer1 interrupt is routed to CPU TINT 1 = Timer1 interrupt is routed to CPU NMI

bitenum.description: Timer1 interrupt is routed to CPU TINT
Timer1 interrupt is routed to NMI

bitfield.description: Timer0 Interrupt Selection 0 = Timer0 interrupt is routed to CPU TINT 1 = Timer0 interrupt is routed to CPU NMI

bitenum.description: Timer0 interrupt is routed to CPU TINT
Timer0 interrupt is routed to NMI

bitfield.description: Describes the Silicon Revision of Die CPU 0 = Silicon Revision 1.0.

HPI byte/word address mode select. 0 = Host address corresponds to a word (16-bit) address. 1 = Host address corresponds to a byte (8-bit) address.

bitenum.description: Host address corresponds to a word (16-bit) address
Host address corresponds to a byte (8-bit) address.

bitfield.description: HPI dual or half word mode select. 0 = full word (16-bit) operation. This setting needs to be used in conjunction with 16-bit multiplexed mode in the Parallel Port Mode of the External Bus Selection Register. 1 = Double word (32-bit) operation. (Not supported)

HPI multiplexed or non-multiplexed mode select. 0 = HPI uses multiplexed mode. 1 = HPI uses non-multiplexed mode. The EMIF address bus is used as HPI address pins. This setting prevents the EMIF from using the Address and Data pins. (Not supported)

Part Code number. Read as 0xB956 (unique code within TI assigned to Phoenix)
Manufacturer ID number. Read as 0x17 (this is TI s manufacturer ID).
A read only bit which will hold a value 1
Version number. Read as 0x0
Part Code number. Read as 0xB956 (unique code within TI assigned to Phoenix)
